title: Lifelong skiers say this New England ski resort is among the best in the U.S., according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Killington Ski Resort in Vermont is listed among the top 15 ski resorts in the U.S. by Travel + Leisure.
Known as 'The Beast of the East,' Killington offers 155 trails, 22 lifts, and spans 1,509 skiable acres.
The resort's new addition is the high-speed Superstar Six chairlift, enhancing its extensive winter sports facilities.

title: Dine Out Boston: What’s new, best deals, and best meals for winter 2026
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Dine Out Boston runs from February 22 to March 7, 2026, featuring 140 participating restaurants offering prix fixe menus.
Lunch prices are set at $27, $32, or $36, while dinner prices are $38, $46, or $55 per person.
New participants include Nowon and The Block at Woods Hill, offering diverse cuisine options in Boston and nearby suburbs.

title: ‘I would like to apologize to Jaylen Brown’: Beverly Hills admits mistake in ending Celtics star’s event
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Beverly Hills admitted a mistake in shutting down Jaylen Brown's NBA All-Star weekend event due to false permit denial claims.
The city acknowledged no permit application was submitted or denied and apologized to Brown and event host James Jannard.
Jaylen Brown criticized Beverly Hills for targeting his event based on bias and indicated potential legal action might be pursued.

title: Emergency room wait times: Readers recount 10- to 30-hour ER stays
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts ER patients experience long wait times, with some accounts of waits ranging from 10 to over 30 hours.
Staff shortages and a lack of inpatient beds are cited as reasons for prolonged emergency room delays in Massachusetts.
State data shows visits lasting over 12 hours have increased from 6.6% in 2020 to 9.9% in early 2024.

title: 14-year-old arrested after man kicked into moving train at Back Bay
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 14-year-old was arrested for allegedly kicking a man into a moving train at Back Bay Station.
The victim, a 27-year-old man, suffered a forehead injury but remained conscious and alert.
The teen faces assault and battery with a dangerous weapon charges; the police investigation is ongoing.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge on local Greater Boston news stories.
Peter Chianca has been Boston.com's general assignment editor since 2019.
The quiz aims to keep readers informed about trending stories in Greater Boston.

title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launches 'Bye Bridget' merch after an internet troll criticized their charitable donations.
Owner Natalie Hug responded to criticism by creating merchandise and continues to donate sale proceeds to charity.
The bakery donates to various causes, supporting organizations for immigrants, LGBTQ+ youth, and homelessness prevention.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kit Boucher died after falling through ice at Bee's River in Eastham on February 14.
The couple's daughter, Katy, commemorated their community-oriented lives and encouraged acts of kindness in their memory.
Visiting hours will be at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans on February 27-28, with a memorial mass on February 28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three recent fires in Fitchburg are being investigated as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Investigators have not determined if fires on Blossom and Day streets are related, but suspect intentional settings.
A third fire on Myrtle Avenue injured one person and displaced seven; it is believed to be unrelated to other fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria', passed away at 53 from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.
An advocate for ALS awareness, Dane was diagnosed in April 2025 and became active in raising support for the disease.
He is survived by his wife Rebecca Gayheart and their two daughters, with a memoir set to release in late 2026.
